question: What is the theme of the 2019 edition of World Press Freedom Day (WPFD)?
option1: Media for Democracy: Journalism and Elections in Times of Disinformation
option2: Keeping Power in Check: Media, Justice and the Rule of Law
option3: Access to Information and Fundamental Freedoms
option4: New Voices: Media Freedom Helping to Transform Societies
answer: Media for Democracy: Journalism and Elections in Times of Disinformation
explanation: The World Press Freedom Day (WPFD) is observed every year on 3rd May as an opportunity to celebrate the fundamental principles of press freedom, assess the state of press freedom throughout the world, defend the media from attacks on their independence, and pay tribute to journalists who have lost their lives in the line of duty. The 2019 theme “Media for Democracy: Journalism and Elections in Times of Disinformation”, discusses current challenges faced by media in elections and its potential in supporting peace and reconciliation processes. The 26th celebration of World Press Freedom Day (WPED-2019) is jointly organized by UNESCO, African Union Commission and the Government of Ethiopia. The main event is being held at the African Union Headquarters at Addis Ababa.
